meanings.sent1: I will intitule this book 'The Adventures of Tom'.
meanings.sent2: Please intitule the new puppy before the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: The cat intituled itself 'King of the House' and demanded treats.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter intituled the room with joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The teacher intituled each student with a superhero name to boost their confidence.

meanings.definition: A title or heading of a document or section.
meanings.sent1: The intitule of the report was 'Financial Analysis'.
meanings.sent2: Can you find the intitule of this chapter in the textbook?
meanings.sent3: The intitule of the menu made everyone laugh as it was misspelled.
meanings.sent4: His intitule as 'Chief Executive Officer' brought him great responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The intitule 'The Great Escape' made the story sound intriguing and adventurous.
